programme.title: Une brique dans le ventre
programme.desc: A contemporary Q-Zen house We head to Lasne to discover a house half-way between sculpture and architecture: the Q-Zen house and its particularly strict ecological and energy-saving requirements. Also on the programme: up-cycling with Namufacture; La Siroperie, a holiday home in Antheit, and how to make a log store. Presented by: Cédric Wautier, Virginie Jacobs.

programme.title: Épicerie fine
programme.desc:
The Maremne and the Marensin
We head for the regions of La Maremne and Le Marensin, where Thomas picks asparagus and strawberries growing in the sandy Landes soil. Between vines and cellar Alan's wines keep him fully occupied. All about the Landes pastis and local actions in favour of the climate.
Presented by: Guy Martin Directed by: Émilie Darnaud (France, 2022)

programme.title: La tête à l'endroit
programme.desc: Flavigny: its aniseed, history and regional identity Flavigny-sur-Ozerain is considered as one of France's finest villages. The municipality, whose narrow streets are brimming with architectural treasures dating from the Middle Ages and the Renaissance, delights passers-by and occasional visitors. Presenter: Guillaume Pierre.

programme.title: L'épicerie
programme.desc:
The growing offer of own brands
With their own brands, the big distribution chains increase their profit margins and boost customer loyalty. Investigation. Also, the brining process, additives in processed foods and an introduction to the Swedish saffron buns called "lussekatter".
Presenters: Johane Despins, Denis Gagné.

programme.title: La peinture française autour du monde
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Les 100 lieux qu'il faut voir
programme.desc: The Haute-Garonne, from Toulouse to the foothills of the Pyrenees Lying in south-west France, the Haute-Garonne ("Nauta Garona" in Occitan) is a department that stretches for 145 kilometres. An exceptional geography equalled by its equally exceptional variety of landscapes: plains, rolling green hills, mountains. From Toulouse to the Pyrenees, we meet men and women with a passion for Occitanie. Directed by: Marie David (season 6, France, 2019)

programme.title: Une brique dans le ventre
programme.sub-title: École de village restaurée près de Houffalize
programme.desc: Renovated village school near Houffalize A remarkable result for the renovation of this village school dating from 1870. Jeanne and Amaury used the most environmentally-friendly materials possible. Weekend in Brussels: the Jam Hotel offers a contemplative immersion "made in Japan". Legal affairs with a look at Izimi, the virtual safe. Presented by: Cédric Wautier, Virginie Jacobs.

programme.title: Épicerie fine
programme.desc:
The Pays de Fayence
In the Var, Hugo and Anne-Noëlle open the doors to a farm where they also cultivate well-being. At the Claux Farm, Daniel and Laure offer an open invitation to sample their dairy produce. All about mimosas in Tanneron and the hilltop villages of the Pays de Fayence.
Presented by: Guy Martin Directed by: Émilie Darnaud (France, 2022)

programme.title: La tête à l'endroit
programme.desc: Exploring Jura's regional identity Champagnole is the perfect starting point to visit one of France's best fir plantations: Joux Forest. Guillaume discovers this mysterious would, to learn more about the Jura's regional identity! Presenter: Guillaume Pierre.

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.sub-title: MOBILIER NATIONAL, T.LEMAIRE/ARCHI DECO, VERCINGETORIX, TONNELLERIE
programme.desc: Programme summary: - Behind the scenes at the Mobilier National in Paris - Encounter with Thierry Lemaire, French interior designer - Following the trail of Vercingétorix in Paris - Focus on the art of barrel-making Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: La peinture française autour du monde
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Les 100 lieux qu'il faut voir
programme.desc: The Haute-Garonne, from Toulouse to the foothills of the Pyrenees Lying in south-west France, the Haute-Garonne ("Nauta Garona" in Occitan) is a department that stretches for 145 kilometres. An exceptional geography equalled by its equally exceptional variety of landscapes: plains, rolling green hills, mountains. From Toulouse to the Pyrenees, we meet men and women with a passion for Occitanie. Directed by: Marie David (season 6, France, 2019)

programme.title: Tendance XXI
programme.desc:
Season 7, episode 1:

An in-depth look at the secrets of the French luxury industry, and earrings for men. The Marseilles collective Laissez Passer recycles below-standard and abandoned harbour materials. How to wear satin, whatever the occasion. The association Fleurs d'Halage offers a second life to polluted areas of Paris.

Commentary by: Viviane Blassel.

programme.title: Papilles
programme.desc:
Flora Mikula
One of the few women to have forged a career in a male-dominated world, the chef Flora Mikula settled in the Camargue. She guides us from Nîmes to the boundaries of the Rhône delta, on foot, on horseback, by car... for wonderful food, cheery banter and general love of life.
Presented by: Emmanuelle Delteil.

programme.title: La belle vie
programme.desc: Life in harmony with nature Carole-Lyne Robin has transformed her life by building an off-grid tiny house. Between working as a volunteer with the reindeer and her job as a wildlife ranger, Carole-Lyne lives in harmony with her environment. Presented by: Julien Roussin-Côté.

programme.title: L'épicerie
programme.desc:
Yoghurt
Today you can easily find over 200 varieties of yoghurt on sale. We take a look at what's available and market trends for the future. Plus: testing kitchen whisks, three techniques for making meringue and an interview with the Anishinaabe chef Gerry Brandon.
Presented by: Johane Despins, Myriam Fehmiu.

programme.title: La peinture française autour du monde
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Vachement Normand !
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Ricardo
programme.desc:
Bundt cake and madeleines
Using the same vanilla-flavoured cake mixture, Ricardo prepares two different desserts: a marbled mocha Bundt cake and green tea and frosted lemon madeleines.
Presented by: Ricardo Larrivée.

programme.title: Littoral
programme.desc:
Cordouan, the last inhabited lighthouse
Recently added to the Unesco world heritage list, the Cordouan lighthouse welcomes thousands of visitors each year. For several centuries, it has been an invaluable aid for the complex navigation required to enter the Gironde estuary. A truly exceptional building and an important witness of the history of France. Report by: Olivier Chasle.
Presented by: Marine Barnérias.

programme.title: L'épicerie
programme.desc:

With their own brands, the big distribution chains increase their profit margins and boost customer loyalty. Investigation. Also, the brining process, additives in processed foods and an introduction to the Swedish saffron buns called "lussekatter".
Presenters: Johane Despins, Denis Gagné.

programme.title: Pays et marchés du monde
programme.desc: Riviera Nayarit (Mexique) Découverte du marché de Riviera Nayarit. Présentation : Xavier Petit.

programme.title: Version Française
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: 5 chefs dans ma cuisine
programme.desc: Lamb souvlaki and home-made pita bread Chuck Hughes teaches us how to cook lamb souvlaki and home-made pita bread. Presented by: Marina Orsini. Directed by: Nicole Dussault, David Gauthier, Stéphane Rocheleau, Léo Boulanger (Canada, 2020)

programme.title: Le grand move
programme.desc: Amélie and Stéphano, Frelishburg Amélie and Stéphano were born and bred in Montreal. But despite being very attached to the city, they dreamed of a better life without neighbours. Directed by: Mariloup Wolfe (Canada, 2020)

programme.title: L'épicerie

With their own brands, the big distribution chains increase their profit margins and boost customer loyalty. Investigation. Also, the brining process, additives in processed foods and an introduction to the Swedish saffron buns called "lussekatter".

programme.title: Maestro !
programme.desc: Don Pasquale "Don Pasquale", the comic opera by Gaetano Donizetti and Giovanni Ruffini was performed for the first time at the Comédie-Italienne in Paris, in 1843. Damiano Michieletto made the opera his own when he produced it at the Opéra de Paris in 2018. Presented by: Éric de Lochner. Directed by: Éric de Lochner (France, 2021)

programme.title: Louis et la faune urbaine
programme.desc:
Beaverton, Ontario
Louis discovers some chipmunks in the basement of a house and a client asks for his help to remove a skunk from his garden shed.
Presenter: Louis Larose.

programme.title: Curieux Bégin
programme.desc: Young chefs from Asia Bringing together young chefs and artisans of Chinese origin is the ideal way to concoct a menu with authentic Chinese dishes. A young generation certain to surprise with their creativity. And it's the actress Cynthia Wu-Maheux who's lucky enough to make the most of the result! Presented by: Christian Bégin.

programme.title: Histoire(s) de jardins
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.desc: Behind the scenes at the Gaîté-Lyrique. Encounter with Camille Moncomble, part-jeweller, part-poet, to discover a world recounted with fantasy and modernity. Exploring freemasonry. Focus on the textile artist Viviane Sagnier and her creations in sculpted wool, coloured in infinite shades of ivory. Presented by: Katherina Marx.
